page.title: 18Fishing the River Weaver.1.
page.content: The{River Weaver}flows through the centre of our area and there are four of us from Class 4 of Underwood West Juniors who have fished in this river. You need a line with a breaking strain of about four pounds. The size of your hook can vary,but a size 18 is about right. There are a lot of good fish in the river,like carp, pike,gudgeon and bream. Usually we use maggots as bait,but sometimes we use the fly fishing method. We use self-cocking floats and it is a good idea to use a nine foot rod (about 3 metres) as the river is very narrow in places. Sometimes it pays to use sweetcorn as a bait,especially first thing in the morning or when it has been raining. Dough can be used as well,but we think maggots are the best.
